intro: Bartsia diffusa, commonly known as the hairy bartsia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly referred to as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its lack of true leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and grassy areas. Bartsia diffusa is often found growing in association with other herbaceous plants, forming part of the understory vegetation in its native habitats.
